p:
Low rates of species dispersal can amplify mismatches between species’ range limits and niche limits by constraining range expansions at the leading range edge
23, 25 . If the trailing edge retracts due to increased mortality rates, while the leading edge shifts slowly or remains stable, ratios of extinction to colonization along range boundaries increase, causing the overall range to shrink
12 . In contrast, net extinction rates decrease if range limits track niche limits where the climate is increasingly suitable
26 . Many species’ survival therefore depends on their capacity to disperse and track suitable conditions under climate change
27– 29 .
